metadata.title: CVE-2016-2150 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
SPICE allows local guest OS users to read from or write to arbitrary hostmemory locations via crafted primary surface parameters, a similar issue toCVE-2015-5261.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2150` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspice-server1 - 0.12.6-4ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: spice package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.12.6-4ubuntu0.1').
